title: I am prepared for the worst, but hope for the best.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

title: Do not spoil what you have by desiring what you have not; remember that what you now have was once among the things you only hoped for.
author: Epicurus

title: Hope is the thing with feathers that perches in the soul - and sings the tunes without the words - and never stops at all.
author: Emily Dickinson

title: Hope is not the conviction that something will turn out well but the certainty that something makes sense, regardless of how it turns out.
author: Vaclav Havel

title: To live without Hope is to Cease to live.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

title: You may not always have a comfortable life and you will not always be able to solve all of the world's problems at once but don't ever underestimate the importance you can have because history has shown us that courage can be contagious and hope can take on a life of its own.
author: Michelle Obama

title: All human wisdom is summed up in two words; wait and hope.
author: Alexandre Dumas

title: All kids need is a little help, a little hope and somebody who believes in them.
author: Magic Johnson

title: We have always held to the hope, the belief, the conviction that there is a better life, a better world, beyond the horizon.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

title: Just as despair can come to one only from other human beings, hope, too, can be given to one only by other human beings.
author: Elie Wiesel

title: Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow. The important thing is not to stop questioning.
author: Albert Einstein

title: Three grand essentials to happiness in this life are something to do, something to love, and something to hope for.
author: Joseph Addison

title: The work goes on, the cause endures, the hope still lives and the dreams shall never die.
author: Edward Kennedy

title: Hope in reality is the worst of all evils because it prolongs the torments of man.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

title: Hope is the pillar that holds up the world. Hope is the dream of a waking man.
author: Pliny the Elder

title: God grant me the courage not to give up what I think is right even though I think it is hopeless.
author: Chester W. Nimitz

title: Hope springs eternal in the human breast: Man never is, but always to be blest.
author: Alexander Pope

title: There is no medicine like hope, no incentive so great, and no tonic so powerful as expectation of something better tomorrow.
author: Orison Swett Marden

title: Anyone who doesn't believe in miracles is not a realist.
author: David Ben-Gurion

title: Hope is like the sun, which, as we journey toward it, casts the shadow of our burden behind us.
author: Samuel Smiles

title: Even if the hopes you started out with are dashed, hope has to be maintained.
author: Seamus Heaney

title: Hope will never be silent.
author: Harvey Milk

title: Every day begins with an act of courage and hope: getting out of bed.
author: Mason Cooley

title: Be prepared, work hard, and hope for a little luck. Recognize that the harder you work and the better prepared you are, the more luck you might have.
author: Ed Bradley

title: Hope is being able to see that there is light despite all of the darkness.
author: Desmond Tutu

title: God's mercy and grace give me hope - for myself, and for our world.
author: Billy Graham

title: Hope is the only bee that makes honey without flowers.
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

title: At the end of the day, we must go forward with hope and not backward by fear and division.
author: Jesse Jackson
tags: Fear, Day, End Of The Day

title: The human heart has hidden treasures, In secret kept, in silence sealed; The thoughts, the hopes, the dreams, the pleasures, Whose charms were broken if revealed.
author: Charlotte Bronte

title: Hope is important because it can make the present moment less difficult to bear. If we believe that tomorrow will be better, we can bear a hardship today.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

title: Hope is definitely not the same thing as optimism. It is not the conviction that something will turn out well, but the certainty that something makes sense, regardless of how it turns out.
author: Vaclav Havel

title: Hope is the last thing a person does before they are defeated.
author: Henry Rollins

title: We must accept finite disappointment, but never lose infinite hope.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

title: Let your hopes, not your hurts, shape your future.
author: Robert H. Schuller

title: Hope is patience with the lamp lit.
author: Tertullian

title: Hope lies in dreams, in imagination, and in the courage of those who dare to make dreams into reality.
author: Jonas Salk

title: When you say a situation or a person is hopeless, you are slamming the door in the face of God.
author: Charles L. Allen

title: My hope still is to leave the world a bit better than when I got here.
author: Jim Henson

title: Everything that is done in the world is done by hope.
author: Martin Luther

author: Richard Rohr

title: Hope is a good breakfast, but it is a bad supper.
author: Francis Bacon

title: He that lives upon hope will die fasting.
author: Benjamin Franklin

title: But Hopes are Shy Birds flying at a great distance seldom reached by the best of Guns.
author: John James Audubon

title: I find hope in the darkest of days, and focus in the brightest. I do not judge the universe.
author: Dalai Lama

title: One lives in the hope of becoming a memory.
author: Antonio Porchia

title: A little more persistence, a little more effort, and what seemed hopeless failure may turn to glorious success.
author: Elbert Hubbard

title: If it were not for hopes, the heart would break.
author: Thomas Fuller

author: Vaclav Havel

title: In the end, that's what this election is about. Do we participate in a politics of cynicism or a politics of hope?
author: Barack Obama

title: We must free ourselves of the hope that the sea will ever rest. We must learn to sail in high winds.
author: Aristotle Onassis

title: Hope is a waking dream.
author: Aristotle

title: My great hope is to laugh as much as I cry; to get my work done and try to love somebody and have the courage to accept the love in return.
author: Maya Angelou

title: The capacity for hope is the most significant fact of life. It provides human beings with a sense of destination and the energy to get started.
author: Norman Cousins

title: What gives me the most hope every day is God's grace; knowing that his grace is going to give me the strength for whatever I face, knowing that nothing is a surprise to God.
author: Rick Warren

title: Beware how you take away hope from another human being.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Jr.

title: We must rediscover the distinction between hope and expectation.
author: Ivan Illich

title: Tomorrow hopes we have learned something from yesterday.
author: John Wayne

title: Hope is the only universal liar who never loses his reputation for veracity.
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

title: You all know that I have been sustained throughout my life by three saving graces - my family, my friends, and a faith in the power of resilience and hope. These graces have carried me through difficult times and they have brought more joy to the good times than I ever could have imagined.
author: Elizabeth Edwards

title: We really feel happier when things look bleak. Hope is endurance. Hope is holding on and going on and trusting in the Lord.
author: Michael Novak

title: Hope is like peace. It is not a gift from God. It is a gift only we can give one another.
author: Elie Wiesel

title: Never deprive someone of hope; it might be all they have.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

title: I said to my soul, be still, and wait without hope, For hope would be hope for the wrong thing.
author: T. S. Eliot

title: At the end of the day, all you can hope for is to go on. The older I get, the more I realize that just keeping on keeping on is what life's all about.
author: Janis Ian
tags: Life, Day, End Of The Day

title: Hope is a risk that must be run.
author: Georges Bernanos

title: Extreme hopes are born from extreme misery.
author: Bertrand Russell

author: Vaclav Havel

author: Martha Beck

author: Studs Terkel

title: The sudden disappointment of a hope leaves a scar which the ultimate fulfillment of that hope never entirely removes.
author: Thomas Hardy

author: Jim Henson

title: Hope is independent of the apparatus of logic.
author: Norman Cousins

title: Hope is the word which God has written on the brow of every man.
author: Victor Hugo

title: Hope is tomorrow's veneer over today's disappointment.
author: Evan Esar

title: Uncertainty is the refuge of hope.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

author: Herman Cain

title: Youth is easily deceived because it is quick to hope.
author: Aristotle

title: There can be hope only for a society which acts as one big family, not as many separate ones.
author: Anwar Sadat

title: Chance has never yet satisfied the hope of a suffering people.
author: Marcus Garvey

title: Hope is such a bait, it covers any hook.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

title: You believe that easily which you hope for earnestly.
author: Terence

author: Jonas Salk

title: It's a good place when all you have is hope and not expectations.
author: Danny Boyle

title: Courage is like love; it must have hope for nourishment.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

author: Francois Rabelais

author: Louis C. K.

author: Calvin Coolidge

title: Things start out as hopes and end up as habits.
author: Lillian Hellman

author: Epictetus

author: Will Durant

title: I always entertain great hopes.
author: Robert Frost

author: Epictetus

title: Hope is a talent like any other.
author: Storm Jameson

author: Arthur Ashe

author: W. C. Fields

title: A whole stack of memories never equal one little hope.
author: Charles M. Schulz

author: Zig Ziglar

title: I always believe things are going to work out.
author: Francoise Sagan

author: William Makepeace Thackeray

title: All hope abandon, ye who enter here!
author: Dante Alighieri

author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

author: Abraham Lincoln

author: Mark Twain

author: Elizabeth Bibesco

title: At the moment of death I hope to be surprised.
author: Ivan Illich

title: Expecting something for nothing is the most popular form of hope.
author: Arnold H. Glasow

author: Joel Osteen

title: How disappointment tracks the steps of hope.
author: Letitia Elizabeth Landon

author: Richard M. DeVos

author: Erma Bombeck

author: Bradley Whitford

title: There was never a night or a problem that could defeat sunrise or hope.
author: Bernard Williams

title: A good teacher can inspire hope, ignite the imagination, and instill a love of learning.
author: Brad Henry

title: It is difficult to say what is impossible, for the dream of yesterday is the hope of today and the reality of tomorrow.
author: Robert H. Goddard

title: He who has health, has hope; and he who has hope, has everything.
author: Thomas Carlyle

title: You are not here merely to make a living. You are here in order to enable the world to live more amply, with greater vision, with a finer spirit of hope and achievement. You are here to enrich the world, and you impoverish yourself if you forget the errand.
author: Woodrow Wilson

title: Woe to the man whose heart has not learned while young to hope, to love - and to put its trust in life.
author: Joseph Conrad

title: I hope you will go out and let stories happen to you, and that you will work them, water them with your blood and tears and you laughter till they bloom, till you yourself burst into bloom.
author: Clarissa Pinkola Estes

title: To cherish what remains of the Earth and to foster its renewal is our only legitimate hope of survival.
author: Wendell Berry

author: Dale Carnegie

title: I hope for nothing. I fear nothing. I am free.
author: Nikos Kazantzakis

author: Tena Desae

author: Anne Lamott

author: Ram Charan

title: The youth is the hope of our future.
author: Jose Rizal

title: Art is about changing what we see in our everyday lives and representing it in such a way that it gives us hope.
author: Kehinde Wiley

author: Helen Keller

author: Ashton Kutcher

author: Jack Layton

author: John Buchan

author: Maya Angelou

author: Demetri Martin

title: Our uniqueness, our individuality, and our life experience molds us into fascinating beings. I hope we can embrace that. I pray we may all challenge ourselves to delve into the deepest resources of our hearts to cultivate an atmosphere of understanding, acceptance, tolerance, and compassion. We are all in this life together.
author: Linda Thompson

title: Survival was my only hope, success my only revenge.
author: Patricia Cornwell

title: No matter how dark the moment, love and hope are always possible.
author: George Chakiris

title: Faith has to do with things that are not seen and hope with things that are not at hand.
author: Thomas Aquinas

title: I hope that in this year to come, you make mistakes. Because if you are making mistakes, then you are making new things, trying new things, learning, living, pushing yourself, changing yourself, changing your world. You're doing things you've never done before, and more importantly, you're doing something.
author: Neil Gaiman

title: Hope is some extraordinary spiritual grace that God gives us to control our fears, not to oust them.
author: Vincent McNabb

title: I think the most important thing is to keep active and to hope that your mind stays active.
author: Jane Goodall

title: Each time a man stands up for an ideal, or acts to improve the lot of others, or strikes out against injustice, he sends forth a tiny ripple of hope, and crossing each other from a million different centers of energy and daring, those ripples build a current that can sweep down the mightiest walls of oppression and resistance.
author: Robert Kennedy

title: All that I am, or hope to be, I owe to my angel mother.
author: Abraham Lincoln

title: Darkness comes. In the middle of it, the future looks blank. The temptation to quit is huge. Don't. You are in good company... You will argue with yourself that there is no way forward. But with God, nothing is impossible. He has more ropes and ladders and tunnels out of pits than you can conceive. Wait. Pray without ceasing. Hope.
author: John Piper

title: In the night of death, hope sees a star, and listening love can hear the rustle of a wing.
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

title: I believe that imagination is stronger than knowledge. That myth is more potent than history. That dreams are more powerful than facts. That hope always triumphs over experience. That laughter is the only cure for grief. And I believe that love is stronger than death.
author: Robert Fulghum

title: An athlete cannot run with money in his pockets. He must run with hope in his heart and dreams in his head.
author: Emil Zatopek

title: Maybe all one can do is hope to end up with the right regrets.
author: Arthur Miller

title: But I have found that in the simple act of living with hope, and in the daily effort to have a positive impact in the world, the days I do have are made all the more meaningful and precious. And for that I am grateful.
author: Elizabeth Edwards

title: There is hope for humanity, but in order for us to get there, we really have to interrogate not just what it takes to change laws, but what it takes to change culture that supports laws that uplift humanity and also supports laws that serve to denigrate it.
author: Alicia Garza

title: A dream is the bearer of a new possibility, the enlarged horizon, the great hope.
author: Howard Thurman

title: To be truly radical is to make hope possible rather than despair convincing.
author: Raymond Williams

title: I'm still growing, still learning. I'm still open and vulnerable enough to know there's much more to be taught to me and learned by me. I hope I don't reach my pinnacle on this earth where I think I know it all.
author: Savion Glover

title: Be hopeful. Be optimistic. Never lose that sense of hope.
author: John Lewis

title: When you create Hope in people, you create expectations. When you do not fulfill those expectations, when the change becomes more of the same old, same old, the Hope that was created can only turn to anger, frustration and bitter disappointment.
author: Vermin Supreme

title: Hope smiles from the threshold of the year to come, whispering, 'It will be happier.'
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

title: I hope I can be as good of a father to my son as my dad was to me.
author: Calvin Johnson

title: The future is not Big Government. Self-serving politicians. Powerful bureaucrats. This has been tried, tested throughout history. The result has always been disaster. President Obama, your agenda is not new. It's not change, and it's not hope.
author: Rush Limbaugh

title: You cannot hope to build a better world without improving the individuals. To that end, each of us must work for his own improvement and, at the same time, share a general responsibility for all humanity, our particular duty being to aid those to whom we think we can be most useful.
author: Marie Curie

title: From too much love of living, From hope and fear set free, We thank with brief thanksgiving Whatever gods may be That no life lives for ever; That dead men rise up never; That even the weariest river Winds somewhere safe to sea.
author: Algernon Charles Swinburne

title: There are only two lasting bequests we can hope to give our children. One of these is roots, the other, wings.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

title: Looking after my health today gives me a better hope for tomorrow.
author: Anne Wilson Schaef

title: The Special Olympics motto, 'Let me win, but if I cannot win, let me be brave in the attempt,' really speaks to me because it embodies exactly what I have pursued in my life. Really, that's all any of us can hope for - a chance to be brave and to pursue a dream.
author: Hannah Teter

title: Today's students can put dope in their veins or hope in their brains. If they can conceive it and believe it, they can achieve it. They must know it is not their aptitude but their attitude that will determine their altitude.
author: Jesse Jackson

title: They say a person needs just three things to be truly happy in this world: someone to love, something to do, and something to hope for.
author: Tom Bodett

title: Outside of the cross of Jesus Christ, there is no hope in this world. That cross and resurrection at the core of the Gospel is the only hope for humanity. Wherever you go, ask God for wisdom on how to get that Gospel in, even in the toughest situations of life.
author: Ravi Zacharias

title: There are no greater treasures than the highest human qualities such as compassion, courage and hope. Not even tragic accident or disaster can destroy such treasures of the heart.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

title: I wouldn't trade this experience for the world, and I hope I get to be a part of 'The Voice' for as long as I can.
author: Brynn Cartelli

title: Every avalanche begins with the movement of a single snowflake, and my hope is to move a snowflake.
author: Thomas Frey

title: A very small degree of hope is sufficient to cause the birth of love.
author: Stendhal

title: Forgiving does not erase the bitter past. A healed memory is not a deleted memory. Instead, forgiving what we cannot forget creates a new way to remember. We change the memory of our past into a hope for our future.
author: Lewis B. Smedes

title: The great hope of society is in individual character.
author: William Ellery Channing

title: I hope the fathers and mothers of little girls will look at them and say 'yes, women can.'
author: Dilma Rousseff

title: I hope there will be some good news and some good profits, and people will realize we have a lot of outstanding executives, and a lot of companies that are doing a good job, and those are good companies to invest in.
author: Don Nickles

title: The abuse dies in a day, but the denial slays the life of the people, and entombs the hope of the race.
author: Charles Bradlaugh

title: Out of the fires of desperation burn hope and solidarity.
author: Sharan Burrow

title: I hope I didn't bore you too much with my life story.
author: Elvis Presley

title: Nothing is black or white, nothing's 'us or them.' But then there are magical, beautiful things in the world. There's incredible acts of kindness and bravery, and in the most unlikely places, and it gives you hope.
author: Dave Matthews

title: Selfishness must always be forgiven you know, because there is no hope of a cure.
author: Jane Austen

title: Wherever my story takes me, however dark and difficult the theme, there is always some hope and redemption, not because readers like happy endings, but because I am an optimist at heart. I know the sun will rise in the morning, that there is a light at the end of every tunnel.
author: Michael Morpurgo

title: There is hope and a kind of beauty in there somewhere, if you look for it.
author: H. R. Giger

title: Hope is the poor man's bread.
author: Gary Herbert

title: I've been on food stamps and welfare. Anybody help me out? No. No. They gave me hope, and they gave me encouragement, and they gave me a vision. That came from my education.
author: Craig T. Nelson

title: I only hope that we don't lose sight of one thing - that it was all started by a mouse.
author: Walt Disney

title: Drugs are the enemies of ambition and hope - and when we fight against drugs we are fighting for the future.
author: Bob Riley

title: Remember me when you do pray, that hope doth lead from day to day.
author: Anne Boleyn

title: I hope that people will finally come to realize that there is only one 'race' - the human race - and that we are all members of it.
author: Margaret Atwood

title: I like to be sparkly! It makes me happy. I love to stand out and embrace my uniqueness, and I am very lucky I get to incorporate that into my gear. I hope the sparkle and glitter that I spread makes other people happy, too.
author: Alexa Bliss

title: The moment that changed me for ever was the moment my first child was born. I was happy, filled with hope, and thought, 'Now I understand the whole point of work, of life, of love.'
author: Paul Theroux

title: With so much conflict in the world, space exploration can be a beacon of hope.
author: Anne McClain

title: To communicate the truths of history is an act of hope for the future.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

title: I hope everyone that is reading this is having a really good day. And if you are not, just know that in every new minute that passes you have an opportunity to change that.
author: Gillian Anderson

title: I would like to tell the young men and women before me not to lose hope and courage. Success can only come to you by courageous devotion to the task lying in front of you.
author: C. V. Raman

title: I am closest to my mother, as she is my rock, my pillar of strength, and my world. Not only has she stood by me through all times - happy, sad, and otherwise - but there have even been moments when I had completely lost hope, and her immense belief in me had lifted me up.
author: Amruta Khanvilkar

title: It is only for the sake of those without hope that hope is given to us.
author: Walter Benjamin

title: Hope is necessary in every condition. The miseries of poverty, sickness and captivity would, without this comfort, be insupportable.
author: William Samuel Johnson

title: All the great things are simple, and many can be expressed in a single word: freedom, justice, honor, duty, mercy, hope.
author: Winston Churchill

title: It is my goal to love everyone. I hate no one. Regardless of their race, religion, their proclivities, the desire of their heart and how they want to live their life and the decisions that they make. I can even respect people's decisions and lifestyle choices just as I hope they have the courtesy to respect my decisions and my choices.
author: Kirk Cameron

title: To confront criminals, we need to finish with corruption. If we don't do this, there is no hope.
author: Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador

title: Where I am today... I still have my ups and downs, but I take it one day at a time and I just hope that I can be the best that I can possibly be, not only for myself, but also young people that are out there today that need someone to look up to.
author: Demi Lovato

title: The hope of eternal life is not to be taken up upon slight grounds. It is a subject to be settled between God and your own soul; settled for eternity. A supposed hope, and nothing more, will prove your ruin.
author: Ellen G. White

title: It has never been, and never will be easy work! But the road that is built in hope is more pleasant to the traveler than the road built in despair, even though they both lead to the same destination.
author: Marion Zimmer Bradley

title: In motivating people, you've got to engage their minds and their hearts. I motivate people, I hope, by example - and perhaps by excitement, by having productive ideas to make others feel involved.
author: Rupert Murdoch

title: He who has faith has... an inward reservoir of courage, hope, confidence, calmness, and assuring trust that all will come out well - even though to the world it may appear to come out most badly.
author: B. C. Forbes

title: To not have any hope is where things start to get really bleak. Things are possible. The impossible can be possible.
author: Sarah Paulson

title: Oh man. If I had magic powers... I would hope that I would use them for good. I think I would. But I would do something pretty trivial like making traffic disappear.
